intro: Conomorpha dussii, commonly known as the Dussis' conomorpha, is a species of flowering plant native to specific regions in South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and showy, pentagonal flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded, humid environments. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
